title: Educational Module and Quality Improvement Coaching Design to Enhance Pediatric Vaccination Rates

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental public health and preventive medicine knowledge
context.additional_context: Learner role: Students/job seekers, Domain expertise: Advanced, Subject/occupational field: Social sciences, Delivery method: Online asynchronous (LMS), Assessment method: Formative evaluation-centered, Technology environment: Bring Your Own Device (BYOD)

learning_goals: Learners can explain the public health importance of pediatric vaccinations and develop community health impact analysis capabilities
Learners can design strategies to improve vaccination rates by applying educational modules and QI (Quality Improvement) coaching strategies
Learners can identify at least two applicable vaccination-related QI changes in real clinical settings and develop implementation plans
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
